TextBody:
Hello Don,

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support. 

To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:  

From the screenshot image you have shared, it appears that the solution/jobs you are running are not default jobs and are rather custom built. Please confirm if it is the case?
What is expected output of the job?
Are you running the production environment jobs i.e., BM as well while connected to test DB via scheduled task?
What is the status of same jobs in your production environment?
What is the impact of the issue on your business? 
Who is affected by this issue? 
What steps to troubleshoot the issue have already been taken? 
What are you trying to do or accomplish? 
Is this a new configuration, data collection or report? 
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked? 
When did this issue start?  

Please perform the follow steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred: 
 


Have a great day!

Saqib Sharif
Technical Support Engineer
____________________ _________
Cybersecurity That Works for You
6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX, US 75034
www.netwrix.com
ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MzYBR:ref
Subject: Jo to get ticket status from ServiceNow just showed 1 result    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MzYBR:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000MzYBR:ref

Hi Saqib, we have Dev and Prod environments. The dev has its own AD and ServiceNow environments. Now I added a test environment having separate DB and ServiceNow instances but looks/view at the Prod AD. This would allow me to see almost the Prod environment except where the ServiceNow tickets are created.

Everyday , I am learning how the NEA works including how jobs are being configure.

For this ticket, I think I may have found the issue and doing further testing. Then will update you.

I hope there is a better way to move settings/configurations from Dev to Test and to Prod.
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #438908 - Jo to get ticket status from ServiceNow just showed 1 result

TextBody:
Hi Don,

Thank you for your response and sharing the information. I will be looking forward to your reply. I will connect with your account manager to check if there is any training material available to assist you in using the platform to the fullest.

Have a great day!

Saqib Sharif

TextBody:
Hi Don,

I hope you are doing well. Since I didn't hear back from you after my last email, I am assuming the issue was resolved after verifying the scheduled tasks and verifying if duplicate jobs were running. As such this incident will now be closed. If you require further information, the incident ticket can be reopened within 30 days, after this time a new ticket can be created and linked to this incident ticket for history.

Have a great day!

Saqib Sharif
